intro: Eremospatha, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has a succulent stem and leaves that are adapted to conserve water, making it well-suited for harsh, dry environments. Eremospatha typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in desert scrublands and grasslands. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
